file_content.text: Let's see... and then there was the time I almost shot myself in the foot, that was a close one. What else...?
Oh, y--you're back. I was just recallin' my life. Tryin' to remember the highlights, since I'm about to have my memory wiped clean.
Think I'm done. Not much to reflect on... so, did you get the drug? I'm actually lookin' forward to startin' over.
Things are looking up for you.
It's your lucky day.
I--I hope I make the most of my new life. Or at least something of it.
Try not to screw up your new life.
Get it right this time.
At least if I do, hopefully it will be in new and more exciting ways.
Just shut up and take the drug.
Quit talking.
All right--all right, sorry. Just a little nervous, you know?
Here goes nothin', I guess.
Wuh...? Who are you?
I'm your inquisitor. Tell me about Commander Rylon.
I ask the questions.
I wish I could help you, but I don't... I don't know what that is.
Who I am is inconsequential. Who are you?
Let me ask you that.
I--I... I have no idea who I am. Do you know? Can you tell me?
You're the son of Commander Rylon, a Republic hero. That's all you need to know.
I'll tell you who you are.
I'm the son of Commander Rylon, a Republic hero.
What if I told you you're dead?
Do you know what "dead" means?
Dead? Is--is that my first name or last name?
Don't let anyone tell you who you are. Goodbye.
Decide for yourself.
Oh. So--so long then, thanks for stopping by.
Don't play dumb with me.
Are you faking?
Is dumb a game? Can you teach me how to play?
My work here is done. Goodbye.
I'm satisfied.
Oh, this is where you work. Okay, I'll see you tomorrow then. Bye-bye.
I leave you to figure that out yourself. Enjoy your new life.
Take care.
Uh... I think I'm supposed to say thank you.
Seems like the drug worked, but I can't risk it wearing off.
You still must die. [Kill him]
I'm glad something worked... hey, why do you look so mean all of a sudden? Ahhhhgggg!
Wow, too bad there isn't more of that drug--I got a few memories I could let go of.
Don't we all?
So do I.
I'll tell you, I'd like to forget the smell in here.
Should I take that personally, Vette?
Do you want to forget me?
Of course not. I'll never be able to forget you.
Let's move on, shall we?
Maybe a little shock will help.
Try this. [Shock Vette]
Brrrooowwww! That only brings the painful memories to the surface!
Maybe your brain will get damaged in the next skirmish.
We can hope you hit your head.
One can only hope.
It's all chaos, so you shouldn't have trouble gettin' the mind wipe drug from the lab upstairs.
Zixx... Zixx. Come on, talk to me, Zixx... get up, man....
Zixx can't hear you, and getting up is a bit beyond his skill set right now.
Not going to happen.
And I'm next? Right?
Look at me, Ensign Durmat.
Give me your attention.
But... if I don't look... maybe you're not really here. Oh blast... I looked....
You are a pathetic waste of human space.
You make me sick.
You're right. You're right... I'm worthless.
Please... please, I--I know why you're here. The--the Republic... the Republic's investigating my dad... and an agent's comin' to put the screws to me....
But... I won't break, I promise. Let me live, my dad's secret is safe with me. I--I'm a rock.
Even if that were true, I couldn't take the chance.
Sorry. Too risky.
Come on, you're Sith. Live on the edge a little! Y--you can take it.
You'd crack the minute someone looked at you funny. I just heard you confess to Zixx.
You're full of it.
Yeah, but he's dead now, so he--he can't tell anyone.
You must think I'm an idiot.
Don't insult my intelligence.
Fine, fine, you're--you're an idiot. If it'll save me, I--I'll think whatever you want me to.
My father's done so much for the Empire. Maybe--maybe the apple fell off the tree, kinda far from the tree, but--it's still... the apple's still....
Uh... not exactly sure where I was goin' with that. Please don't kill me!
It's not personal. Orders are orders.
Sorry. [Kill him]
That... that doesn't make me feel any better....
I'm willing to consider alternatives. Is there another solution?
How else can you be silenced?
Hold on, yeah! I just had a thought pop into my head. Quick, before it pops out!
My assignment here was in the medical lab, movin' supplies and makin' deliveries. Th--the docs there were working on something really cool.
It was a drug that was supposed to create temporary amnesia, but it wiped the mind totally clean. The test subjects didn't even know their own names.
So you want me to wipe your mind.
I know what you're suggesting.
Wow... y--you Force users really can read thoughts. Yeah.
Go on.
Sounds pretty farfetched to me.
That's hard to believe.
I swear it's true. They tested and tweaked and tested and tweaked, but all it ever did was completely wipe the mind.
You--you could break into the lab and bring back the drug. I'll overdose and not know nothin' no more.
That way my dad's secret identity is safe.
Tell me where to find this drug.
Direct me.
You'll be getting a second chance at life.
Could be fun.
I've never had a second chance before.
The medlab is in the back building. The head doc kept a small supply of the drug in his footlocker.
I'll wait right here. Like I have a choice.
Killing you will be less cruel. And faster.
I think not. [Kill him]
Oh man... don't tell... don't tell my dad that I... that I... cried....
I'm putting you out of my misery.
Die, scum! [Kill him]
But who will put me out of my misery?
Poor fool. Not sure we've ever come across anyone so useless.
There's still much of the galaxy left to explore.
Give us time.
You are so right. But now the bar's been set pretty high. I mean, low.
Not everyone can be as talented as you, Vette.
I like having you around.
A compliment? I'll take it.
He even makes you seem valuable.
You should know.
Ouch, that's hitting below the belt.
It smells awful here. Let's move on, shall we?
If it wasn't for the entertainment value that collar provides, you'd be just as useless.
[Shock Vette]
Yow-ow-ow! I'll try... try to do better.
Pipe down, Durmat. There's something going on outside. I'm trying to listen.
Come on, Zixx, throw me a bone. Who's this agent that's comin' to interrogate me? At least answer that, will ya?
Fine, fine, stay clamped. I don't care who it is, I ain't talking. Nobody's gonna get nothin' outta me. Nothin'....
All right, all right, I ain't proud, I give! My dad's an Imperial agent!
What did you say? Your dad is a what?
He said his father is a spy.
He spilled the beans.
Yes, please repeat that, junior.
Do tell.
All I heard him say was "I'm ready to die."
He signed his death warrant.
Oh... oh... oh... no.
This is a restricted area. What are you doing here? Who are you?
It's--it's not a who, it's a what... S... Si... Sith....
That's right, I'm Sith.
Exactly.
I am death.
Fear me.
Heh, like I couldn't tell you were bad news the moment I saw you?
He's going to need a new pair of pants.
He soiled himself.
Who cares what Durmat needs. You gave me enough time to get what I need.
Uh, I have a very bad feeling about this.
Take a look behind yourself, Sith. That's what two squads of the Republic's finest looks like.
Order them to yield, or you're all dead.
Surrender.
Surrender? You're surrounded.
You're about to see what two squads of the Republic's deadest look like.
Not for long.
Finally, a fight worthy of me!
Good, I like it rough!
Come on, men, let's send this Sith home in a body bag.
